head.title: Auction Buyer Finds Skeleton in Car Trunk

identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York

hedline.hl1: Auction Buyer Finds Skeleton in Car Trunk

abstract.p: Car salvage dealer finds human skeleton in trunk of car he bought at New York City auction; police say car was towed off Queens street in Feb (S)

block.p: The owner of a car salvage business in Flatlands, Brooklyn, discovered a human skeleton yesterday in the trunk of a car he had bought at a city auction, the police said.
The man, who owns Auto Gobbler, at East 56th Street and Preston Court, discovered the skeleton when he popped open the trunk of a 1993 red Chevrolet Lumina.
The owner of a car salvage business in Flatlands, Brooklyn, discovered a human skeleton yesterday in the trunk of a car he had bought at a city auction, the police said.
The man, who owns Auto Gobbler, at East 56th Street and Preston Court, discovered the skeleton when he popped open the trunk of a 1993 red Chevrolet Lumina.

Police officials did not know when the man had bought it at auction, but they said the car was towed off the street in February from a neighborhood in northern Queens. It was then sent to a storage center in College Point to await sale.
The police said they were investigating the origins and the identity of the skeleton, although they did not know who was the previous owner of the Chevy.
